title: Develop Foundational Art & Design Skills
description: Focus on developing your core artistic abilities. This can be done during or after your O/L or A/L studies. Practice drawing, learn about color theory, composition, and typography. A strong portfolio of personal projects is key.

title: Master Design Software & Formal Education
description: Gain proficiency in industry-standard software. Simultaneously, consider a diploma or degree in graphic design or visual communication to learn design principles and theory in a structured environment.
qualifications: Diploma or BSc in Graphic Design/Multimedia

title: Junior Graphic Designer
description: Work as a junior designer in an advertising agency, a tech company, or a corporate in-house team. You'll work under the guidance of senior designers on a variety of projects like social media posts, brochures, logos, and web banners.

title: Mid-Level/Senior Graphic Designer
description: As a senior designer, you will take on more complex projects, lead design concepts, and mentor junior designers. You might specialize in areas like branding, UI/UX design, or motion graphics.
institutes: All major advertising agencies and tech companies

title: Art Director or Freelance Designer
description: At this stage, you can progress to an Art Director role, leading the visual style and images for entire campaigns, or establish a successful freelance career, working directly with a diverse range of clients.
